results.title: Still on the same way (A)
results.creator_credit: Graham Cavanagh, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Orcalia Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
The Australian Aboriginals connection to the land and to his sacred sites has often been misunderstood by white Australia. With the help of the Aborigines from Gilwi Community, near Timber Creek, Northern Territory, Bob Ellis of the Sacred Sites Authority and spokesmen from the Northern Land Council, this program clearly explains what sacred sites are, the aboriginal concept of land tenure and how development by white Australia is managed in the Northern Territory through a mandatory consultation process, set down in the Aboriginal Land Rights Act.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Cavanagh, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Orcalia Productions

results.title: Kidnapped
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
In the late 19th Century thousands of South Sea Islander people were kidnapped and taken to Northern Queensland as “kanakas”, slave labourers, to work on the sugar plantations. This documentary traces the history of the Pacific people in Australia and includes interviews with descendants of the slave-labourers, both in Queensland and the South Pacific. With the advent of the White Australia Policy many thousands of South-Sea Islanders were deported from Australia, but many others fled the authorities and lived in the Queensland bush. Their children and grandchildren now form a strong Islander community in and around the city of Mackay in Queensland.

results.title: What's mad to you? Part 2. New approaches
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A group of psychiatrists and counsellors who offer alternative kinds of psychiatric help talk about their methods. They all stress that the need for change has to come from the patients themselves and that any change is likely to be small and not likely to happen quickly. Some of their patients also talk about their treatment and we are shown brief glimpses of sessions between therapist and patient.

results.title: Hungry Ghosts
results.creator_credit: Zi Zhong Wang, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
During Adelaide’s Chinese cultural week in 1988 a group of puppeteers from Adelaide’s sister city of Penang were invited to present one of their plays in honour of the Festival of Hungry Ghosts which fell at this time. The program shows their ritualistic preparations and some of the other festivities which took place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zi Zhong Wang, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV

description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
During Adelaide’s Chinese cultural week in 1988 a group of puppeteers from Adelaide’s sister city of Penang were invited to present one of their plays in honour of the Festival of Hungry Ghosts which fell at this time. The program shows their ritualistic preparations and some of the other festivities which took place.

results.title: The Tempest in Bali
results.creator_credit: Ugo Mariotti, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
In 1988 a group of students from Murdoch University under the leadership of David George and Serge Tampalini staged a production of Shakespeare’s “The Tempest” in Bali during the monsoon. The program documents the various bureaucratic problems they encountered and the assimilation of Balinese dance, music and shadow puppets into the production.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.

results.title: The Story of steel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Industry Series No. 1”.
The story of the manufacture of steel, from the mining of the three raw materials, through the refining process, to the finished product in the rolling mill.
results.description:

results.title: Beechworth [B&W]
results.creator_credit: National Trust, John Kingsford-Smith and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
Historic buildings of the former gold mining town of Beechworth, Vic., including the gold office, prison, powder magazine, churches and the Court House where Ned Kelly was tried three times.
